Self-Playing Flute

PROJECT OVERVIEW

One day I was brainstorming ideas for a project that I could build. I flashed back to my elementary school days where for some reason we all learned the recorder? Say what you will about the recorder but I thought that music class was dope and it made me wonder if I could build a robot to play the recorder for me. I picked up a penny whistle (basically a recorder) for ~$10 off of Amazon and got to work. Watch the journey of building the self-playing flute below.

Technical Details

This project uses 6 SG90 servo motors, an LCD i2c screen, an Arduino Uno, a potentiometer, some custom 3D printed parts, a custom PCB, and rubber spaghetti

I used Arduino port manipulation commands to send simultaneous PWM pulses to the 6 motors. Each note corresponds to a particular byte in the code.

The code in question is object oriented and uses 2 different classes. A note class which holds a particular byte and port manipulation command, and a song class which holds an array of notes and has functions like "play_song".

Songs are hard coded for now, which the user can select by cranking the potentiometer and pressing a button on the circuit board.
